[i]A former Siracusan city judge, hoping to do right by law and justice.[/i]

Real Name: Lavinia Falcone

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Oohara Sayaka]].

title: asashio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Asashio's Kai Ni and Kai Ni D forms.

On her second remodel, she dresses the same way as Kasumi and Ooshio. Asashio wears a black pinafore dress over a long-sleeved white shirt, belt and black thighhighs. Her gear has been upgraded and torpedo launchers have been strapped to her thighs. In Asashio's alternate version (Kai Ni D) her main guns are replaced by anti-aircraft guns, her pinafore dress is covered by the white sleeved garment covering her shoulders, and her thighhighs are replaced by pantyhose.

Her Kai Ni D (a transport destroyer) reflects her final mission where she was sunk while escorting a convoy in the battle of the Bismarck Sea. Even her damaged lines as Kai Ni and Kai Ni D give reference to this battle.

title: potato_(mario_power_tennis)

[quote]
This is also a design I drew for tennis, but I didn't propose it. By the way, her name is Potato. (I would be embarrassed if it meant something strange overseas)😅
for tennisGC.🤔
I thought it was a rather unimpressive design.🤔
It was designed with the image of a rich country girl in mind. Her personality is laid-back and a little clumsy. The character type may be unexpectedly power type.🤔
[/quote]

title: taurus_judge
body:
A large [[revolver]] manufactured by the Brazilian firearms company Taurus International since 2006. The Judge is visually distinctive thanks to its unusually long cylinder, which enables the weapon to chamber both .45 Colt ammunition and .410-bore shotshells (which have the same case head dimensions). A carbine version, the [b]Circuit Judge[/b], is also offered in partnership with another Brazilian arms manufacturer, Rossi.

[[Smith & Wesson]] introduced a virtually identical handgun, the [b]Governor[/b], in 2011.

title: the_winged_dragon_of_ra
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[yu-gi-oh!|Yu-Gi-Oh]], one of the 3 Egyptian God cards and the "leader" of the group.

Famous for its ridiculous amount of powerful effects it has in the [[Yu-gi-oh! duel monsters|anime]], with 22 in total. Ranging from being immune to almost all card effects, its effects being unnegateable, allows the user to destroy any card on the field by paying Life Points, can attack any monster that is summoned during the opponent's turn, allow the user to do "point-to-point" transfer by transferring their LP and the card's ATK/DEF back-and-forth as they wished, requires a specific "summoning chant" to be successfully summoned, and much more.

Due to this, when the [[real life]] version of the card were released in 2010, it was heavily downgraded to have a handful amount of effects. After more powerful monsters made their debut and the game's power ceiling has been steadily risen over the year, [[Konami]] later introduced a large number of support cards to emulate Ra's anime effects.

English name: The Winged Dragon of Ra
Japanese name: The Winged Divine Dragon of Ra

h4. Variants
* [[The Winged Dragon of Ra - Immortal Phoenix]]
* [[the winged dragon of ra - sphere mode|The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode]]

h4. See also

* [[Obelisk The Tormentor]]
* [[Osiris The Sky Dragon]]

title: journey_in_the_auspicious_snow_(girls'_frontline)
body:
The [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]]'s seventh complete costume set (fourth "purchaseable":[https://twitter.com/GirlsFrontlineE/status/1209331092953550848]) in [[Girls' Frontline]], introduced in December 2019.

It consists of a white [[fur-trimmed jacket]] and a [[wing collar|wing-collared]] [[shirt]], the option between a [[necktie]] or a [[neck ribbon]], a [[belt pouch]] and [[holster]], [[gloves]], the option between [[fur-trimmed pants]] or [[fur-trimmed shorts]], each coming with [[fur-trimmed boots]], and with the ponytail hairstyle, a [[hair ribbon]]. Optionally, though appearing less frequently in art, are the party headdress and the backpack accessory, which using the "Infinite Surprise Dye", can be respectively changed from their fake reindeer antlers and Christmas nicknacks to an assortment of options.

Though the default costume bares a white-black color scheme, the red-black recolor accessible by using the dyes is fairly common in fanart, as it provides a look that's reminiscent of the [[Griffin & Kryuger military uniform]]. Other viable recolors include black-blue, green-brown, orange-grey, etc.

title: yuki_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. He is a member of the guild Weiß Flügel Landsol Branch.

He is an [[otoko no ko]] [[crossdressing|crossdresser]] [[elf]] who has [[purple eyes]], [[puffy chest]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[blunt bangs]]. He wears a [[black leotard]], [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[pink skirt]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[purple sleeves|purple]] [[lace-trimmed sleeves]], [[black thighhighs]], [[purple footwear]], [[purple belt]], and a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[bonnet]].

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of his include:
* [[yuki_(oedo)_(princess_connect!)|Oedo Yuki]]
* [[yuki_(ceremonial)_(princess_connect!)|Ceremonial Yuki]]

[spoiler]His name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[yuki (real) (princess connect!)|Nijimura Yuki]] (虹村 雪).[/spoiler]

He is voiced by [[Oozora Naomi]].

body:
[b][i]Why Raeliana Ended Up at the Duke's Mansion[/b][/i] is a Korean webnovel written by Milcha. It has been serialized in Kakao's digital comic and fiction platform KakaoPage since September 19, 2016. A webtoon adaptation was first serialized in KakaoPage on September 3, 2017, and is illustrated by Whale. An anime television series adaptation by Typhoon Graphics aired from April to June 2023.

title: vlad_love
body:
anime series created by [[Oshii Mamoru]]

[[Bamba Mitsugu|Mitsugu Bamba]] is a high school girl who finds meaning in donating blood. She frequently visits a blood bank to donate blood, despite being harshly treated by the nurse. One day, she encounters a beautiful girl who looks like she's from overseas at the blood bank. The pale girl looks like she's about to faint any minute, but then, she starts destroying the blood bank. The girl loses consciousness and Mitsugu takes her home.

title: doupo_cangqiong
body:
A Chinese light novel which has received multiple media adaptations.

manga illustrations by [[ren xiang]]

[quote]In a land where there is no magic, a land where the strong make the rules and weak have to obey, a land filled with alluring treasures and beauty, yet also filled with unforeseen danger. [[Xiao Yan (doupo cangqiong)|]], who has shown talents none had seen in decades, suddenly lost everything three years ago - his powers, his reputation, and his promise to his mother. What sorcery has caused him to lose all of his powers? And why has his [[nalan_yanran_(doupo_cangqiong)|fiancee]] suddenly shown up?[/quote]

title: snow_shovel
body:
A [[shovel]] that has been designed for shoveling snow. Typically features a wide rectangular blade that usually lacks sides and is commonly made of plastic or a lightweight metal.  They're frequently ribbed and tend to come in a variety of colors.

h4. Types

* Scoop
** Traditional: Straight handle with wide flat shovel head (Example: post #6107451)
** Ergonomic: Bent handle with wide flat shovel head
* Push
** Standard: U-shaped handle with a wide snow plow-like shovel head
** Sleigh/Sled: U-shaped handle with a wide deep shovel head (Example: post #5951938)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Snow shovel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snow_shovel]

title: harpoon
body:
A melee/thrown [[weapon]] and fishery tool consists of a metal rod with a sharp hooked blade at the end. Originally designed to impale [[fish]] or any marine creatures ([[whale]]s, [[shark]]s, etc.) and bring up the catch after it was hooked by the blade.

There are several variants of harpoons, ranging from classic stabbing/throw variant, to larger version tied to a [[boat]] or [[ship]] to prevent the catch from escaping. Modern harpoon typically comes in to form of a [[harpoon gun]] to hit any potential catch with greater accuracy.

title: harpoon_gun
body:
A weapon/fishing tool and a variant of [[harpoon]]. As its name implies, it (typically) fires harpoon at a target to either drive it away or to restrain it with a tied rope on  the other end of the harpoon to prevent them from escaping.

While there exists a harpoon gun that doesn't fire an actual harpoon (as some fire an explosive projectile instead, similar to an actual [[cannon]]). For tagging purposes, this tag is specifically refers to the "traditional" harpoon gun that fires harpoon, as such, apply this tag when the harpoon is visible on the device.

title: kino_(kino_no_tabi)
body:
Female protagonist of [[Kino no Tabi]].

Kino is a composed, stoic, and precocious teenager who travels with her talking motorrad, [[Hermes (kino no tabi)|]]; the two have a contract—Kino provides the balance, Hermes provides the speed, and together they can travel anywhere they wish.  Although Kino appears apathetic at first, she is a caring and understanding person. She travels through different countries to experience their customs and understand their histories, but she never stays longer than three days, as she is afraid of settling down, and would thus cease being a traveler.

Kino is portrayed with either [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]] and [[green eyes]] or [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]]. She wears a [[black jacket]], [[brown coat]], [[white shirt]], [[goggles on headwear|goggled cap]] and wide [[belt]] with lots of [[pouch]]es — using special gear depending on the weather or season as necessary, she is typically armed with a [[Colt 1851 Navy]] [[revolver]].

Due to her [[androgynous]] appearance, her gender is often confused by both viewers and other characters in the series.

[spoiler]"Kino" is also the name of her predecessor.[/spoiler]

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. Wears a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief|red]] [[neckerchief]], [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

title: battle_of_berlin
body:
[b]The Battle of Berlin[/b], designated as [b]the Berlin Strategic Offensive Operation[/b] by the [[Soviet Union]], and also known as [b]the Fall of Berlin[/b], was one of the last major offensives of the European theatre of [[World War II]].

After the Vistula–Oder offensive of January–February 1945, the [[Soviet Army]] had temporarily halted on a line 60 km (37 mi) east of Berlin. On March 9th, Germany established its defence plan for the city with Operation Clausewitz. The first defensive preparations at the outskirts of Berlin were made on March 20th, under the newly appointed commander of Army Group Vistula, "General Gotthard Heinrici":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gotthard_Heinrici .

When the Soviet offensive resumed on April 16th, two Soviet fronts (army groups) attacked Berlin from the east and south, while a third overran German forces positioned north of Berlin. Before the main battle in Berlin commenced, the Red Army encircled the city after successful (but very costly) battles of the Seelow Heights and Halbe. 

On April 20th, 1945, [[Adolf Hitler]]'s birthday, the 1st Belorussian Front led by "Marshal Georgy Zhukov":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgy_Zhukov , advancing from the east and north, started shelling Berlin's city centre, while Marshal Ivan Konev's 1st Ukrainian Front broke through Army Group Centre and advanced towards the southern suburbs of Berlin. On April 23th General Helmuth Weidling assumed command of the forces within Berlin. The garrison consisted of several depleted and disorganised Army and Waffen-SS divisions, along with poorly trained Volkssturm and Hitler Youth members. Over the course of the next week, the Red Army gradually took the entire city.

On April 30th, Hitler and several of his officials committed suicide. The city of [[Berlin]]'s garrison surrendered on May 2nd but fighting continued to the north-west, west, and south-west of the city until the end of the war in Europe on May 8th (May 9th in the Soviet Union) as some German units fought westward so that they could surrender to the Western Allies rather than to the Soviets.

h4. See also
* [[Raising A Flag Over The Reichstag]]

title: imperial_japanese_navy
body:
Posts containing references to the real life Imperial Japanese Navy, such as depictions of historical events, ships, or sailors with clear evidence of the colors or uniforms of Imperial Japan. [b]Don't tag [[Kantai Collection]] or [[Azur Lane]] posts unless they directly reference the real world Imperial Japanese Navy, such as post #1764484.[/b]

h4. History

The Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) was the navy of the Empire of Japan from 1868 to 1945. Following Japan's defeat in [[World War II]], it was replaced with the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] (JMSDF). Although the IJN participated in several wars, including the Sino-Japanese War, the suppression of the Boxer Rebellion in China, and a decisive victory in the Russo-Japanese war, it is primarily known for its participation in WWII.

h4. See also

* [[Kongou (Battleship)]]
* [[Musashi (Battleship)]]

title: shinano_(aircraft_carrier)
body:
[b]Shinano[/b] was an [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] during [[World War II]].

Originally laid down as the third [[Yamato_(battleship)|Yamato-class]] battleship, after the losses suffered at the [[Battle of Midway]] her half-completed hull was converted into an aircraft carrier. Construction was expedited after further losses during the Battle of the Philippine Sea, and Shinano was launched on October, 8th 1944 at Yokosuka Naval Arsenal. She was commissioned on November 19th, and dispatched nine days later to Kure Naval Base to complete her fitting out. En-route Shinano was torpedoed by American submarine USS Archerfish, and because much of her water-tight fixtures and damages-control equipment was not operational, she flooded and sank on November 29th, 1944. Shinano remains the largest warship to be sunk by a submarine.

h4. See also

* [[Shinano (Warship Girls R)]]

title: kongou_(battleship)
body: Lead ship of her class, last [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] capital ship built in foreign yard. One of the most advance warship at the time of her construction, combining heavy firepower, high speed, and adequate protection. Reconstructed from 1929-31 (and reclassified as fast battleships), further reconstructed from 1935-37. Blew up and sank in 2 hours in 1944 after being hit by 1 torpedo from [[United States Navy]] [[submarine]] "Sealion".

title: a6m_zero
body:
The [b]Mitsubishi A6M[/b] was the primary carrier-based fighter aircraft operated by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during [[World War II]]. Its long designation was "Type 0 Carrier Fighter" (零式艦上戦闘機), and it was commonly called "Reisen" (零戦, zero fighter) by its pilots. This nickname was also popular among the Allies, more so than the official reporting name "Zeke". The plane was designed by [[Horikoshi Jirou]]. 

When the [b]ZERO[/b] was first introduced in 1940 it was considered the most capable carrier-based fighter, combining excellent maneuverability with a good climb rate and a very long operational range. These qualities combined with the excellent training of IJN pilots allowed the Japanese to win numerous early victories over their Allied adversaries. Because of its attributes the Zero was instrumental in the success of the attack at [[Pearl Harbor]].

However, after the Americans introduced the [[F6F Hellcat]] and [[F4U Corsair]] in 1942, both of which are much faster, have longer operational range, and are more resilient and have better armor than the Zero, it began to struggle to compete against both planes, particularly due to its weak airframe and being particularily vulnerable to boom-and-zoom tactics. In the later half of the war, with [[battle_of_midway|the loss of experienced IJN pilots]], the Zero were mostly assigned as suicidal [i][[kamikaze pilot|kamikaze]][/i] aircraft in a desperate attempt to defend the country of [[Japan]].

h4. See also

* [[Sakai Saburou]] - greatest Zero fighter ace ever.
* [[Kaze Tachinu]]
* [[Cosmo Zero]]
* [[A6M2-N]]
* [[Ki-43 Hayabusa]] - similar aircraft in terms of appearance and performance 
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): Type 0 Carrier Fighter":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9B%B6%E5%BC%8F%E8%89%A6%E4%B8%8A%E6%88%A6%E9%97%98%E6%A9%9F
* "Wikipedia: Mitsubishi A6M Zero":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_A6M_Zero

title: brutalizer
body: Also known as the [I]Scissored Armbar Crossface[/I], [I]Double Underhook Crossface[/I], or the [I]Double Arm Crossface[/I], it is a variation of the [[crippler crossface]] that is innovated by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler Nagata Yuuji as the [I]Nagata Lock III[/I]. It is a scissored armbar combined with a crossface, where the attacking wrestler traps one of the prone opponent's arms in his/her legs, wraps the opponent's other arm under the attacker's shoulder, and then applies the crossface. It is popularized in the present time by [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Pac as the [I]Brutalizer[/I]. Other known users of this hold includes former professional wrestler [[Dave Bautista|Batista]] (who calls his version as the [I]Batista Bite[/I]), WWE wrestler Tommaso Ciampa (as the [I]Sicilian Stretch[/I]), All Elite Wrestling wrestlers Julia Hart (who uses a sitting variant which she calls as the [I]Hartless[/I]), and Dr. Britt Baker D.M.D. (who uses a combination with a Mandible Claw which she calls as the [I]Lockjaw[/I]).

title: magazine_(weapon)
body:
A device used for storing [[ammunition]] and feeding it into a repeating [[gun|firearm]]. May be referred to as a "mag" for short. Found in internal as well as external types, the most common is the detachable box magazine, such as that used by most modern [[assault_rifle|assault rifles]] and semi-automatic [[handgun]]s. Magazines generally have [[spring (object)|spring]]-like object inside that pushes ammunition into the chamber.

Not to be confused with a [[clip_(weapon)|]], a simple strip that store multiple rounds together as a unit for [[reloading]] into the fixed magazine or cylinder of a firearm.

h4. See also

* [[ammunition belt]]

* [[clip (weapon)]]
* [[drum magazine]]

title: dragunov_svd
body:
The [b]SVD[/b] (Russian: Снайперская винтовка Драгунова, СВД) is a Soviet 7.62×54mmR semi-automatic [[sniper rifle]], designed in 1963 by Yevgeny Dragunov. Having a reliable short-stroke gas piston system, the SVD is not based on the [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] despite similar appearance. It is issued with a standard PSO-1 [[scope|telescopic sight]] and standard 10-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]].

The original SVD is identifiable by its pistol grip integrated with the buttstock, and two-piece front handguards with long rectangular perforations, while their length leaves the gas tube exposed.
This tag also applies to the modernized [b]SVDM[/b], which has all-black furniture and triangular folding stock. 

h4. See also
* [[Dragunov SVU]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[PSL Romak]]
* [[SVD (Girls' Frontline)]]

* [[Zastava M70]]

title: year_of_the_pig
body:
The Pig is the last of 12 animals representing the Chinese zodiac. The following are years of the Pig: 1935, 1947, 1959, 1971, [[1983]], [[1995]], [[2007]], [[2019]], 2031.

A [[year of the dog|Dog year]] always comes before the [b]Year of the Pig[/b], and a [[year of the rat|Rat year]] always comes afterwards in the next 12-year Chinese zodiac animal cycle.

In Japan, the wild [[boar]] is used instead of the (domesticated) pig.

h4. See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_dog
body:
The [b]Year of the Dog[/b] is not any particular year in history, but a recurring position in the 12-year zodiac cycle. Years of the Dog include 1934, 1946, 1958, 1970, [[1982]], [[1994]], [[2006]], [[2018]], and 2030.

The Dog occupies the eleventh position in the Chinese zodiac, after [[year of the rooster|the Rooster]], and before [[year of the pig|the Pig]].

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_monkey
body:
The Monkey is the ninth of 12 animals in the recurring 12-year Chinese zodiac cycle. Monkey years include: 1932, 1944, 1956,  1968, 1980, [[1992]], [[2004]], [[2016]], 2028.

The [b]Year of the Monkey[/b] always occurs after a [[year of the goat|Goat year]] and before a [[year of the rooster|Rooster year]].

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_ox
body:
The Ox occupies the second position in the Chinese Zodiac. Years of birth include 1913, 1925, 1937, 1949, 1961, 1973, [[1985]], [[1997]], [[2009]], [[2021]], 2033.

An [b]Year of the Ox[/b] always occurs after a [[year of the rat|Rat year]] and before a [[year of the tiger|Tiger year]]. Artists often portray female characters dressed up as or resembling a [[cow]] since cows are simply female oxen.

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_tiger
body:
The Tiger ranks the third of the animals in the Chinese zodiac. Years of birth include 1914, 1926, 1938, 1950, 1962, 1974, [[1986]], [[1998]], [[2010]], [[2022]].

A [b]Year of the Tiger[/b] always occurs after an [[year of the ox|Ox year]] and before a [[year of the rabbit|Rabbit year]].

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_rabbit
body:
The [b]Year of the Rabbit[/b] is fourth in the Chinese Zodiac. These are Rabbit years: 1939, 1951, 1963, 1975, [[1987]], [[1999]], [[2011]], [[2023]].

A Rabbit year always occurs after a [[year of the tiger|Tiger year]] and before a [[year of the dragon|Dragon year]].

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_rat
body:
The [b]Year of the Rat[/b] is the first in the Chinese zodiac cycle. Birth years include 1924, 1936, 1948, 1960, 1972, [[1984_(year)|1984]], [[1996]], [[2008]], [[2020]].

A Rat year always occurs after a [[year of the pig|Pig year]] and before an [[year of the ox|Ox year]].

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: super_mario_rpg
body:
[i]Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars[/i] is an RPG co-developed by [[square enix|Squaresoft]] and [[Nintendo]], originally released for the Super Famicom and SNES in 1996. 
Received a remake in 2023 for [[Nintendo Switch]], dropping the [i]Legend of the Seven Stars[/i] subtitle.

Not to be confused with [i]Paper Mario RPG[/i] or [i][[Mario & Luigi RPG]][/i], the Japanese names for [i][[Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door]][/i] and  [i][[Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga]][/i], respectively.

title: breeze_(arknights)
body:
[i]Breeze, Medic Operator of Rhodes Island, will prove that teasing and treatment go hand in hand[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Grace Arizona

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 24[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td][[fox girl|Vulpo]][/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]162 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

The only daughter of a noble branch family from Victoria. In the course of her medical training, she came into contact with Rhodes Island, at which point she applied to join the company. She is particularly skilled in pharmacology and clinical theory. She provides battlefield medicine and first aid services to Rhodes Island.

Her motif is based on foxes. Uses a staff during combat.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Ikezawa Haruna]].

title: stray_(game)
body:
[b]STRAY[/b] is a 2022 [[cyberpunk]] adventure [[video game]] developed by BlueTwelve Studio and published by "Annapurna Interactive":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annapurna_Interactive . 

The story follows [[ginger_(stray)|a stray cat]] who falls into a walled city populated by [[robot]]s, machines, and mutant [[monster]] bacteria, and sets out to return to the surface with the help of a drone companion, [[b-12_(stray)|B-12]]. 

The game is presented through a third-person perspective. The player traverses the game world by leaping across platforms and climbing up obstacles, and can interact with the environment to open new paths. Using B-12, they can store items found throughout the world and hack into technology to solve puzzles. Throughout the game, the player must evade the antagonistic [[zurk_(stray)|Zurks]] and [[guardian_(stray)|Sentinels]], which attempt to kill them.

Stray was announced in 2020 and became highly anticipated. It was released for [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation 5]], and Windows in July 2022, and for [[Xbox One]] and [[Xbox Series X]]/S in August 2023; a macOS version is in development. 

The game received generally positive reviews, with praise for its artistic design, [[cat]] gameplay, narrative, original score, and platforming elements, though critics were divided on the combat and stealth sequences. Stray received accolades at The Game Awards, Game Developers Choice Awards, and Golden Joystick Awards, and appeared on multiple publications' year-end lists. An animated film adaptation is currently in development.

title: mount_suribachi
body:
[b]Mount Suribachi[/b] (摺鉢山, [i]Suribachiyama[/i]) is a 169-metre (554 ft)-high mountain on the southwest end of [[Iwo Jima]] in the northwest Pacific Ocean under the administration of Ogasawara Subprefecture, [[Tokyo (city)|]] Metropolis, [[Japan]].

The mountain's name derives from its shape, resembling a suribachi or grinding bowl. It is also known as "Mount Pipe" (パイプ山, [i]paipu-yama[/i]), since the volcanic gas and water vapor that rolls in from the summit, alongside the rest of the island, give the appearance of a smoking pipe when viewed from the sea.

Joe Rosenthal's iconic [[World War II]] photograph, [[Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima]], depicting [[united states marine corps|United States Marines]] raising an American flag, was taken at the mountain's peak during the Battle of Iwo Jima in 1945. Ammunition ship [i]USS Suribachi[/i] was named after this mountain.

h4.See also
* [[Letters From Iwo Jima]]

title: yasukuni_shrine
body: A [[Shinto]] shrine located in [[Tokyo (city)|]], [[Japan]]. Built to honour deceased Japanese soldiers during the Imperial era of Japan (1876 - 1951). The shrine has became a focal point in East Asian political debate (specifically [[China]] and [[Korea]]), as it was the resting place of several notorious war criminals during Japanese conquest of Asia and [[World War II]], including [[toujou hideki|Hideki Tojo]].

title: hudson
body:
[b]Hudson Soft Co., Ltd.[/b] was a Japanese [[video game]] company that released numerous games for video [[game console]]s, home computers and mobile phones, mainly from the 1980s to the 2000s. It was headquartered in the Midtown Tower in Tokyo Midtown, Akasaka, Minato, [[Tokyo (city)|]], [[Japan]], with an additional office in the Hudson Building in Sapporo.

Hudson Soft was founded on May 18, 1973. Initially, it dealt with personal computer products, but later expanded to the development and publishing of video games, mobile content, video game peripherals and music recording. 

Primarily a video game publisher, it internally developed many of the video games it released while outsourcing others to external companies. It is known for series such as [[Bomberman]], [[Takahashi Meijin no Bouken Jima|Adventure Island]], [[Star Soldier]], and [[PC-Genjin|Bonk]]. Hudson also developed video games released by other publishers such as the Mario Party series from Nintendo.

Hudson Soft made the [[PC Engine]]/TurboGrafx-16 in association with [[NEC Corporation]], to compete against [[Nintendo]], [[SEGA]], and [[SNK]], while continuing making games on other platforms as a third-party developer.

The mascot of the company is a [[bee]] named [[Hachisuke]]. Hudson Soft ceased to exist as a company on March 1, 2012, and merged with [[Konami]] Digital Entertainment, which was the surviving entity. Konami owns the assets of Hudson and has since rereleased its video game back catalogue on different occasions.

title: nec_corporation
body:
[b]NEC Corporation[/b] (日本電気株式会社, [i]Nippon Denki Kabushiki-gaisha[/i]) is a [[Japan]]ese multinational information technology and electronics corporation, headquartered in Minato, [[Tokyo (city)|]]. 

The company was known as the [b]Nippon Electric Company, Limited[/b], before rebranding in 1983 as [b]NEC[/b]. It provides IT and network solutions, including cloud computing, artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of things (IoT) platform, and telecommunications equipment and software, to business enterprises, communications services providers and to government agencies, and has also been the biggest Personal [[Computer]] vendor in Japan since the 1980s, when it launched the PC-8000 series.

In 1987, NEC licensed technology from [[Hudson]] Soft, a video game manufacturer, to create a video [[game console]] called the [[PC Engine]] (later released in 1989 as the TurboGrafx-16 in the North American market). While the PC Engine achieved a considerable following, it has been said that NEC held a much stronger influence on the video game industry through its role as a leading semiconductor manufacturer than through any of its direct [[video game]] products.

NEC was the world's fourth-largest PC manufacturer by 1990. Its semiconductors business unit was the world's largest semiconductor company by annual revenue from 1985 to 1992, the second largest in 1995, one of the top three in 2000, and one of the top 10 in 2006. NEC spun off its semiconductor business to Renesas Electronics and Elpida Memory. Once Japan's major electronics company, NEC has largely withdrawn from manufacturing since the beginning of the 21st century.

NEC was #463 on the 2017 Fortune 500 list. NEC is a member of the Sumitomo Group.

h4. See also

* [[NEC PC-8801]]
* [[PC-98 (computer)]]

title: jimmy_doolittle
body:
Honorary General [b]James Harold Doolittle[/b] was an [[United States|American]] military general and aviation pioneer.

Best known for the eponymous [i]Doolittle Raid[/i], a daring bombing raid on [[Tokyo (city)|]] on 18 April 1942 during [[World War II]]. Whilst the raid caused minimal damage, it greatly affected the Japanese military to take more cautious stance against enemy air raids, which were often cited as a contributing factor in the American victory at the [[Battle of Midway]]. After the raid, he would serve as a bomber group commander over both theatres of the war.

In shipgirl context, he is usually paired with a personification of USS [[Hornet (kancolle)|]], the ship that his [[B-25 Mitchell]] bombers took off from during the raid.
other_names: ジミー・ドーリットル

title: tiananmen_square
body:
A city square in the center of [[Beijing]], [[China]]. Located between the eponymous Tiananmen gate and the [[Forbidden City]].

The site, and the gate to an extent, has significant political significance for the modern history of China. Oversaw the events spanning from the Opium war and Boxer rebellion in 19th century, the declaration of the founding of the PRC in 1949, and the site of the Tiananmen Square protest in 1989.

Outside of China, the square is best known for being the site of the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre, to which anti-CCP dissident refers to it simply as 8964 (the date of the crackdown in year/month/day format).

h4. See also

* [[Tank Man]]
* [[tag group:History]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Tiananmen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiananmen]
* "Wikipedia: Tiananmen Square":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiananmen_Square]
* "Wikipedia: 1989 Tiananmen Square protests":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1989_Tiananmen_Square_protests_and_massacre]

He and his brother [[Alphonse Elric|Alphonse]] attempted to resurrect their mother, [[Trisha Elric|Trisha]], through alchemy. For that, Ed lost his left leg, while Al's whole body was taken by 'The Truth'. Sacrificing his right arm, Edward bonded Alphonse's soul to a suit of armor. 

After receiving [[prosthetic arm]], Edward joined the State Military at the age of 12, in resolve to restore Al to normal. He has a Napoleon complex of sorts, becoming easily irritated when commented about his height.

title: wryyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy
body:
A battle cry typically given off by [[vampire]]s throughout [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], notably [[Dio Brando]]. 

It's also shout by Dio after delivering [[steamroller|the finisher]] of his [[ZA WARUDO]] (a.k.a. "[[The World]]") supermove. Paired with a leaned-back, knees-bent, pseudo-pelvic-thrust sort of stance (think [[Dragon Ball Z|DBZ]]-style power-ups in the other direction).

The twenty (20) "Y"s are derived from the stick figure Flash animation (see: post #107964) that made the move all the more infamous across the Internet.

Dio's son, [[Giorno Giovanna]], also uses this battle cry.

h4. See also

* [[road roller da! (meme)|]]

title: dio_brando
body:
Main antagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 1 and 3, also playing an indirect, yet major, part in Part 6. Becomes a [[vampire]] during the events of Part 1 via the [[Stone Mask (jojo)|]]. Gains a [[Stand (jojo)|]] power named [[The World]] in Part 3.

Had many illegitimate children during his time as a vampire lord, most notably [[Giorno Giovanna]], the main protagonist of Part 5. Three of his other sons also appear in Part 6 as antagonists, [[Donatello Versus]], [[Rikiel]], and [[Ungaro]].

His namesakes are Ronnie James Dio and Marlon Brando.

Famous for memes such as [[wryyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy]], [[ZA WARUDO]], and [[ROAD ROLLER DA! (meme)|]].

h4. See also
* [[Kono Dio Da (meme)|]]
* [[I reject my humanity (meme)|]]
* [[Heaven Ascended Dio]]

title: sword_girls
body:
A Korean Flash-based online collectible card game developed by [i]Zeonix[/i], featuring over a thousand individual cards with which players may pick and play from in either a PvP or PvE setting.

New cards are regularly added on a sporadic basis. These cards are designed by artists from South Korea and Japan. Their lead artist is [[Salt (salty)]].

Game closed down due that the company managing it Zeonix went bankrupt, and the game's servers closed down permanently. Outside of a few unofficial PC ports, the game can't be played anymore.

On the 18th of August, 2020, Korean game company Game Meca announced they bought the rights to the game, with plans of rereleasing the game as a mobile game in early 2021. The mobile game version of Sword Girls was finally released in English in 2023 under the name [b][[Kana Tales]][/b].

title: dahlia_(day_of_wrath)
body:
[[infinitypilot]]'s original character from the Doom rewrite fanfic [[Day of Wrath (infinitypilot)|]].

Dahlia is a [[demon girl]] with pink-[[red skin]], orange-[[yellow eyes]], swept-back brown horns, and long black hair with 2-4 braids. She wears a Star of David necklace and has a black choker tattoo around her neck. Her signature attire is a brown croptop and a simple brown skirt tied around her waist.
She is not a succubus but a type of former human known as a [[nymph]].

Despite the brutal and violent setting and franchise she's associated with, Dahlia is bizarrely gentle and docile, frequently depicted in a lonely or submissive position.

title: nekketsu_kouha_kunio-kun
body:
The first game in the [[Kunio-kun series]].

[i][b]Nekketsu Kōha Kunio-kun[/b][/i] (熱血硬派くにおくん, [i]Hot-Blooded Tough Guy Kunio[/i]) is a 1986 Japanese [[arcade]] [[video game]] where the player takes control of a high school boy called [[Kunio-kun]] as he fights against the various gangs who bully his friend, Hiroshi, at the start of each stage.

The original arcade game was created by "Kishimoto Yoshihisa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshihisa_Kishimoto and developed by "Technos Japan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Techn%C5%8Ds_Japan (who would become famous for the [[Double Dragon]] series) and published by [[Taito]].

The international version, renamed [i][b]Renegade[/b][/i], features changed graphics and dubbed voices that gives the game a more western-looking setting. The plot was also changed from Kunio beating gangs to avenge his friend to the main hero having to rescue his girlfriend. [i]Renegade[/i] itself would spawn two sequels in Europe.

The game was ported to the [[Nintendo]] [[Famicom]] home console in early 1987 and to the western [[NES]] at the end of the same year. It was released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in Japan as part of the Ore-tachi Game Center Zoku lineup on January 26, 2006.

h4. See also

* [[Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari]]

title: winged_hussar

Sometimes memed by their [[sabaton (band)|Sabaton]] "song":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rcYhYO02f98] about their role in the Battle of Vienna where they fought off the [[Ottoman Empire]].

body:
[[Senran Kagura]] character. A third-year Shinobi at the Hanzou Academy. She is the oldest in the group.

Ikaruga has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and flat [[bangs]]. She wears the regular [[school uniform]] for Hanzou Academy. When she transforms into a Shinobi, she wears a white, gold-trimmed [[jacket]] with six buttons. She wears an [[armband]] on her left arm for Hanzou Academy. She also has a white, gold-trimmed [[skirt]] and [[boots]], with [[black pantyhose]] underneath.

When her uniform has been ripped off, she wears a [[black bikini]].

Her seiyuu is [[Imai Asami]].

title: cathyl
body:
A [[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]] character. Cathyl is a [[cow girl|female minotaur]].

Cathyl is a very [[tall female|tall]] (231cm / 7'7") and [[muscular female|muscular woman]], with [[huge breasts]] (Q-cup) that [[breast expansion|grow]] even [[gigantic breasts|larger]] when full. Her B-W-H measurements are 171(Q)-79-130. 
She has [[brown eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils]]. She keeps her [[two-tone hair]] (dark [[brown hair|brown]] and [[white hair|white]]) in a [[ponytail]] with [[striped hair|stripes]] going down the length of it. She has a thick dark brown [[facial mark|stripe under each of her eyes]].

As a Minotaur, she has a pair of large upward-facing [[cow horns]] on her head, [[cow ears]], [[cow tail]], and a [[animal legs|cow legs]] (starting from [[knees]]) which are covered with fur and have [[hooves]] instead of feet.

Her clothing consists of nothing but [[torn overalls|ripped]] [[blue overalls]] with a relatively small [[cow print]]ed [[bikini|trikini]] top underneath (although in the recent chapters the bikini was absent or missing) and a pair of [[work gloves]]. She also wears a [[cowbell]] around her neck.

She used to work as a farm hand on a Black Lily Ranch doing lots of heavy lifting and power work. She is in a relationship with the ranch's owner, and later transferred to the Black Lily Ranch to share her expertise. She is frequently seen with her friend [[Merino (monster musume)|]].

h4. External links
* "Monster Musume Wiki: Cathyl":[https://dailylifewithamonstergirl.fandom.com/wiki/Cathyl]

body:
Character in [[Isekai Meikyuu de Harem wo]]. Roxanne is the first party member and slave of [[Kaga Michio]].

Roxanne is described as stunningly beautiful, with enchanting reddish [[brown eyes]], magnificent [[lips]], thick chestnut [[brown hair]], and [[large breasts]]. Her height is similar to Michio's, a little over 160 cm. She is a [[dog girl]] who has soft [[floppy ears|floppy]] [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail]].
Roxanne usually wears a [[black hairband]], [[black collar|black]] [[o-ring collar]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[green shirt]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], [[green pants]], [[black belt]], and [[sandals]]. She also wears a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt]].

She is voiced by [[Mikami Shiori]].

title: lantern_on_liquid
body:
[[Lantern]] floating in water.

They're often seen in "Ghost Festival":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghost_Festival] (Chinese Zhongyuan Jie or Japanese "Obon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bon_Festival]) and some "Lantern festivals":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lantern_Festival] such as Thailand "Loi Krathong":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loi_Krathong]. In both Taoists and Buddhists, releasing lanterns on water is known as a ritual to transmute and absolve the sufferings of the deceased.

title: anaconda_vice
body:
A [[submission hold]] innovated by [[New Japan Pro Wrestling|NJPW]] wrestler Tenzan Hiroyoshi and also used by [[All Elite Wrestling]] alumnus and current [[WWE]] wrestler [[CM Punk]].

The Anaconda Vice is done from a position in which the wrestler and the opponent are seated on the mat facing each other. The wrestler sits on one side of the opponent and using his near arm encircles the opponent in a headlock position and grabs the opponent's near wrist, bending the arm upwards. Then, the wrestler maneuvers his/her other arm through the "hole" created by the opponent's bent wrist, locks his/her hand upon his/her own wrist, and then pulls the opponent forward, causing pressure on the opponent's arm and neck.

It can also be spelled as [b]Anaconda Vise[/b] and its technical name is [i]Arm-Trap Triangle Choke[/i].

title: suika_game
body:
A puzzle game developed by AladdinX where you merge fruits to create a [[watermelon]] ([i]suika[/i] in Japanese). Similar to the game "2048". The player drops a random fruit into a box. Fruits of the same type will merge into a different larger fruit, with the largest fruit being a watermelon. The game ends if the fruits overflow the box.

You start with the [[Cherry]] as the smallest fruit, then later on [[Strawberry]], [[Grapes]], [[Dekopon (fruit)|]], [[Persimmon]]s, [[Apple]]s, [[Nashi Pear|Pear]]s, [[Peach]]es, [[Pineapple]], [[Melon]]/[[Cantaloupe]], and finally, Watermelon.

The game has gained sudden popularity after it was played by various Japanese [[virtual YouTuber]]s, though controversy after the developers forbade the clipping of the gameplay footage by third parties later caused the VTubers to switch to fan games/clones instead. The ban has since been lifted.

h4. External links

* "Official page":https://www.aladdinx.jp/pages/suika-game (Japanese)
* "Product page on Nintendo website":https://www.nintendo.com/us/store/products/suika-game-switch/
* "Wikipedia: Suika Game":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suika_Game

title: loser_gesture
body: The Loser Gesture is a {{hand_gesture|hand gesture}} made by extending the right thumb and {{index_finger_raised|index fingers}}, leaving the other fingers closed to create the letter L, interpreted as "loser", and generally given as a demeaning sign. Sometimes this is accompanied by raising the {{hand_on_own_forehead|hand to the giver's forehead}}.

title: spock
body:
A very famous character from the original [[Star Trek]] [[Science fiction]] TV series.

[b]Spock[/b] is the science officer of the [[USS Enterprise]]. He is a [[Vulcan]]. 

His trademark salute is the [[Vulcan Salute]].

Spock was played by the late actor [[Leonard Nimoy]] in the original series and its film adaptations, and "Ethan Peck":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethan_Peck] in the modern series of the same continuity. In the [[star trek: kelvin timeline|alternate timeline reboot]] series he is played by actor "Zachary Quinto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zachary_Quinto.

title: mazinger_z
body:
[i][b]Mazinger Z[/b][/i] (マジンガーZ [i]Majingā Zetto[/i]) is a classic and extremely influential and popular giant [[super robot]] manga that ran in [i]Weekly Shonen Jump[/i] from 1972 until 1973. The series was created by [[Nagai Gou]] (Kiyoshi Nagai).

The story tells the adventures of [[Kabuto Kouji]], the young brave pilot of Mazinger Z, a powerful [[mecha]] with super powers that fights against evil hostile giant [[robot]]s called "mechanical [[monster|beasts]]".

Due to its popularity the original manga was turned into a 92 episode anime that debuted also in late 1972 and ended in 1974. It has spawned several notable sequels and spinoff series, among them [[UFO Robo Grendizer]], [[Mazinkaiser]], and [[Robot Girls Z]].

Mazinger Z was broadcast in several countries and became very famous worldwide. Its fame in some European countries was such that even "a giant statue of the titular robot":http://trip-n-travel.com/listicle/16496/ was erected in the province of Tarragona, [[Spain]], in the year 1979. 

It was also a very popular anime in [[Mexico]] during the 1980s, where it was dubbed into [[spanish_text|Spanish]] directly from the Japanese version, keeping all the original Japanese character names intact and broadcasting all the complete 92 episodes, unlike the version later aired in the [[united_states|U.S.]] (which was called [i][b]Tranzor Z[/b][/i] and was not very popular due to its severe censorship and many absent episodes).

Mexican director [[Guillermo del Toro]] has cited this show as a very important influence on his movie [[Pacific Rim]]. The comic [[Karmatron y los Transformables]] was also heavily influenced by Mazinger.

This tag should be used for the original manga/anime and related media. For the franchise as a whole use [[Mazinger (series)]].

title: i_hate_kids_with_good_instincts_like_you_(meme)
body:
An infamous scene from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]] where [[Edward Elric]] confronts [[Shou Tucker]] after realizing the latter performed alchemy [spoiler]on [[Nina Tucker|his daughter Nina]] and [[Alexander_(fma)|his dog Alexander]][/spoiler] to create a [[shou tucker's chimera|chimera]].

The scene is best remembered for Tucker's half-angry, half-cynical expression and his reply to Edward: "I hate kids with good instincts like you." In some localization, the word "kids" were switched into "brats" instead.

References to this scene will often include a character in the Edward role inquiring about the whereabouts of other characters and the dates of past events. The character in the Tucker role will usually reply something to the effect of, "I hate [X] with good instincts like you."

title: indian_elephant
body:
The Indian elephant ([i]Elephas maximus indicus[/i]) is one of three extant recognized subspecies of the Asian [[elephant]] and native to mainland Asia.

In general, Asian elephants are smaller than [[African elephant|African elephants]] and have smaller ears, but relatively broader skulls and larger trunks than African elephants.

Notably, one of these elephants were mentioned in [[Pokedex]] entries for [[Raichu]] and [[Gastly]], despite the near-total absence of real life animals in [[Pokemon]].

[b]MS-13 Gatsha[/b]

It is armed with dual [[missile pod]]s, [[claws]] and a powerful short-ranged [[spiked mace]] launcher gun (called the "Hammer Gun").

A Demon Lord Digimon. Belphemon has two forms: [[belphemon sleep mode|Sleep Mode]], in which it resembles a [[chibi]] bat-like creature with horns on its head, an [[uwu]] face and chains restraining it locked in place by an alarm clock, and [[belphemon rage mode|Rage Mode]], where it takes the form of a huge, muscular, clawed monster with the chains ruptured and multiple wings on its back. As a member of the Seven Great Demon Lords, it represents the sin of Sloth, and has the title "Roar of Awakening" (目覚めの咆哮, [i]Mezame no Houkou[/i]). 

For the purposes of this tag, both forms of Belphemon will be treated as one and the same.

title: shiran_no_ka_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a scene in [[Space Adventure Cobra]]. It involves a character anticipating something happening, another character asking what will happen afterwards, and receiving an ironic response from the first, punctuated by 知らんのか ("You don't know?"). The meme received a lot of attention in social game circles under the format:

"What happens when maintenance ends?"
"You don't know?"
"That's when maintenance begins."

title: genesis_breaker
body:
An official 2022 side story project set in the [[Mospeada]] [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime universe.

Produced by [[Tatsunoko Pro]]duction,  [b][i]Genesis Climber Mospeada: Genesis Breaker[/i][/b] is a side story set in the original [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] TV series timeline. 

[[Aramaki Shinji]] and [[Kakinuma Hideki]] ([[Bubblegum Crisis]], [[Armitage III]], [[Gall Force]], [[Junk Force]]), main staff of the original [[1980s_(style)|80s]] series, are returning as mechanical designers for the new project.

Genesis Breaker will start serializing in [[Hobby JAPAN]] magazine in August 2022 with a story written by Kakinuma that is parallel to the events of the original series.

In accordance with the launch of the new project, Tokyo-based toy/figure manufacturer Sentinel company plans to release a 1/12 action figure of a new [[ride armor]] design for the series. 

h4. Main characters

* [[Gate (Mospeada)]]

Her [[idol clothes|main outfit]] consists of [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[bear ears]], [[bear hair ornament]], [[earrings]], [[white gloves|white]] [[paw gloves]], a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[fur-trimmed dress|fur-trimmed]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[layered dress|layered]] [[plaid dress]] decorated with yellow, [[pink ribbon|pink]], [[blue ribbon]]s and [[teddy bear]]s, [[pink thighhighs]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

title: youkai_mountain
body:
Youkai Mountain (妖怪の山 Youkai no Yama) is [[Gensokyo]]'s largest mountain and volcano. As its name implies, it is inhabited almost exclusively by [[traditional youkai]], primarily [[kappa]] and [[tengu]], and where humans are generally not welcome.
It later became a key location, when the [[Moriya Shrine]] was transported near to the mountain's summit.

title: gatling_033
body:
Gatling 033 (ガトリング033, Gatoringu 033), also known by the codenames Rush (ラッシュ, Rasshu) and Henrietta (アンリエッタ, Anrietta), is a Second Generation Object of the Information Alliance's Sky Dog(br) 3rd C.E.B, piloted by the Elite commonly referred to as "Oh ho ho".

The Gatling 033 is made up of a spherical main body with a cross-shaped float and treads located directly below that. The floats extend to the front, back, left, and right. The two to the left and the right each have a rapid fire beam cannon Gatling gun installed on the top of the end.

It has over 100 cannons, both large and small, but it does not have all that many on the side. It has almost 20 smaller cannons on each side. This is likely to give priority to the main cannons.

The cockpit is a sphere of about 2 meters across with a giant monitor attached to the front. A large number of keyboards are lined up on three stepped levels. The third step spreads out in a U-shape around the edge of the cockpit. In the space not taken up by keyboards, an inscription reads “Manual Interface ‘JULIET’.

body:
